oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena

Class DatasetGraphOracleSem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraphWrapper
      • org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraphTrackActive
        • oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.DatasetGraphOracleSem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer, org.apache.jena.atlas.lib.Closeable, org.apache.jena.atlas.lib.Sync, org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraph, org.apache.jena.sparql.core.Transactional
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatasetGraphOracleHybrid

    public class DatasetGraphOracleSem
extends org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraphTrackActive
implements org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraph, java.util.Observer
    An implementation of ARQ's DatasetGraph interface that works with Oracle Database 11g Semantic Technologies. Each instance of this class will have a corresponding backend Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model and a corresponding application table (with a column of type SDO_RDF_TRIPLE_S). Inserts/deletes performed through method calls add or delete will be translated to insert or delete triples/quads against the associated application table.

    A single database connection will be used behind the scenes to handle all JDBC calls. For performance reasons, changes made through method calls add or delete will not be committed immediately. One can explicitly commit all the changes through commitTransaction(), or commit will be called automatically when close() is executed.

    To create an instance of this class, use the createFrom(GraphOracleSem) method. The DatasetGraphOracleSem object created from the call will use the same underlying model as the GraphOracleSem object passed as the argument. Both objects will share the same JDBC connection. This means committing the transaction in the GraphOracleSem object will commit changes made in the derived DatasetGraphOracleSem object and vice versa. Additionally, any connections settings modified in one object will also apply to the other. For example, setDOP(int) will change the degree of parallelism for both objects.

    It is recommended that the GraphOracleSem object is closed right after the DatasetGraphOracleSem object is instantiated. For example, 

      
    GraphOracleSem gos = new GraphOracleSem(...); 
    DatasetGraphOracleSem dsgos = DatasetGraphOracleSem.createFrom(gos);
    gos.close();
    ... start using dsgos ...

    Although the DatasetGraphOracleSem object and its underlying GraphOracleSem object share the same JDBC connection, closing either object will not close the other object. Both objects must be closed in order to free any shared resources.

    Some methods in this class return Graph objects. These Graph objects all share the same JDBC connection and resources with the DatasetGraphOracleSem instance that created them. To ensure underlying connections to the corresponding Oracle backend are closed properly and resources are freed, close all Graph objects acquired through the getGraph or getDefaultGraph methods after use. Failure to close these Graph objects may prevent closing of the underlying JDBC statements used implicitly by this class.

    For consistency with the functionality provided by GraphOracleSem, this class supports bulk loading through the prepareBulk and completeBulk methods. This class also supports midtier caching (using populateCache) and inferencing (using performInference).

    Since:
    Nov. 2011

      • addGraph

        public void addGraph(org.apache.jena.graph.Node graphName,
                     org.apache.jena.graph.Graph graph)
        Add the given graph to the dataset and assign it the specified graph name. This method will replace any existing data in the specified named graph. To add data to an existing named graph, use add(Quad) or call getGraph(Node) and use the Graph API to add triples.

        The graph returned by getGraph(Node) may not be the same object as the graph passed as an argument here.

        Changes will be committed to the database after this API call.

        Specified by:
        addGraph in interface org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraph
        Overrides:
        addGraph in class org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraphWrapper
        Parameters:
        graphName - name to assign the graph in this dataset
        graph - graph containing data to add to the dataset, possibly replacing existing data.
        See Also:
        add(org.apache.jena.sparql.core.Quad)

      • analyze

        public void analyze()
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics using default parameters for this dataset. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for this graph (Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model).

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a significant amount of change has been done to a graph, this method should be invoked. Notice that however, statistics collection is a time/resource consuming process, so only run it when necessary.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyze

        public void analyze(float estimatePercent,
                    java.lang.String methodOpt)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for this dataset. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for the underlying Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model of this graph.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a significant amount of change has been done to a graph, this method should be invoked. Notice that however, statistics collection is a time/resource consuming process, so only run it when necessary.

        See Oracle documentation "PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference" for detailed explanations of the parameters.
        Parameters:
        estimatePercent - has a valid range of [0.000001,100].
        methodOpt - A typical value for methodOpt is "FOR ALL COLUMNS SIZE AUTO."
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyze

        public void analyze(float estimatePercent,
                    java.lang.String methodOpt,
                    int dop)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for this dataset. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for the underlying Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model of this graph.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a significant amount of change has been done to a graph, this method should be invoked. Notice that however, statistics collection is a time/resource consuming process, so only run it when necessary.

        See Oracle documentation "PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference" for detailed explanations of the parameters.
        Parameters:
        estimatePercent - has a valid range of [0.000001,100].
        methodOpt - A typical value for methodOpt is "FOR ALL COLUMNS SIZE AUTO."
        dop - degree of parallelism. Note that on a balanced hardware setup, running this method with a dop > 1 can significantly shorten the statistics calculation time.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyzeInferredGraph

        public void analyzeInferredGraph()
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for the inferred graph that is derived from this dataset and the attached models and rulebases. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke the DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for inferred data.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a performInference() call is done, this method should be invoked.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyzeInferredGraph

        public void analyzeInferredGraph(float estimatePercent,
                                 java.lang.String methodOpt)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for the inferred graph that is derived from this dataset and the attached models and rulebases. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for inferred data.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a performInference call is done, this method should be invoked.

        See the "Oracle Database PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference" for detailed explanations of the parameters.
        Parameters:
        estimatePercent - has a valid range of [0.000001,100]
        methodOpt - A typical value for methodOpt is "FOR ALL COLUMNS SIZE AUTO."
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyzeInferredGraph

        public void analyzeInferredGraph(float estimatePercent,
                                 java.lang.String methodOpt,
                                 int dop)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for the inferred graph that is derived from this dataset and the attached models and rulebases. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for inferred data.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a performInference call is done, this method should be invoked.

        See the "Oracle Database PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference" for detailed explanations of the parameters.
        Parameters:
        estimatePercent - has a valid range of [0.000001,100]
        methodOpt - A typical value for methodOpt is "FOR ALL COLUMNS SIZE AUTO."
        dop - degree of parallelism. Note that on a balanced hardware setup, running this method with a dop > 1 can significantly shorten the statistics calculation time.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • clearRepository

        public void clearRepository()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Removes all quads from this dataset and the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model in a persistent fashion (no rollback possible). This method will not remove any data from attached models and will fail if the underlying model is virtual (e.g. read-only).

        This method performs a DDL operation that implicitly commits the transaction and prevents rollback.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • close

        public void close()
        Flushes any pending statements, commits transaction, and closes this dataset instance. Note that the underlying JDBC statements may remain open since they may be shared with other graphs.

        It is the responsibility of the caller to createFrom to close this instance after use.

        Specified by:
        close in interface org.apache.jena.atlas.lib.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraph
        Overrides:
        close in class org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraphTrackActive
        See Also:
        closeWithoutCommit()

      • close

        public void close(boolean force)
        Flushes any pending statements, commits transaction, and closes this dataset instance. Note that the underlying JDBC statements may remain open since they may be shared with other graphs, if force input parameter is false. Otherwise all JDBC resources will also be closed.

        It is the responsibility of the caller to createFrom to close this instance after use.

        Parameters:
        force - if true all unserlying JDBC statements will be closed
        See Also:
        closeWithoutCommit()

      • closeWithoutCommit

        public void closeWithoutCommit()
        Flushes any pending statements and closes this dataset instance without committing the transaction. Note that the underlying JDBC statements may remain open since they may be shared with other graphs.

        It is the responsibility of the caller to createFrom to close this instance after use.

        See Also:
        close()

      • closeWithoutCommit

        public void closeWithoutCommit(boolean force)
        Flushes any pending statements and closes this dataset instance without committing the transaction. Note that the underlying JDBC statements may remain open since they may be shared with other graphs if forced input parameter is false.

        It is the responsibility of the caller to createFrom to close this instance after use.

        Parameters:
        force - if true any internal JDBC resources will be closed even if there are shared resources between graphs
        See Also:
        close()

        public void commitTransaction()
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Persists changes. Other database sessions can see the changes after this method call.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • completeBulk

        public void completeBulk(java.lang.String flags,
                         java.lang.String tableName)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.sql.SQLException
        Loads triples/quads from a given staging table into this dataset. Note that this method does not update the inference closure.

        To load triples/quads from an InputStream into a staging table, see prepareBulk.

        If no staging table name was specified to the call to prepareBulk, then the staging table name argument to this method, tableName, should be null. When the staging table name, tableName, is null, then this method will use the default staging table names used by prepareBulk when prepareBulk automatically creates staging tables.

        This method does not remove any data from the staging table or drop the staging table. The same staging table may be used multiple times with this method.

        Parameters:
        flags - option to pass to the underlying operations. For example, to run the data loading in parallel degree 4, one can set the flags to "PARSE PARALLEL_CREATE_INDEX PARALLEL=4 mbv_method=shadow"
        tableName - name of the staging table holding the triples/quads to load into this dataset
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a problem inserting the data into the underlying Oracle semantic model
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        prepareBulk(java.io.InputStream, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.StatusListener, java.lang.String, boolean)

      • completeBulk

        public void completeBulk(java.lang.String flags,
                         java.lang.String tableName,
                         boolean truncateStagingTab)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.sql.SQLException
        Loads triples/quads from a given staging table into this dataset. Note that this method does not update the inference closure.

        To load triples/quads from an InputStream into a staging table, see prepareBulk.

        If no staging table name was specified to the call to prepareBulk, then the staging table name argument to this method, tableName, should be null. When the staging table name, tableName, is null, then this method will use the default staging table names used by prepareBulk when prepareBulk automatically creates staging tables.

        This method does not drop the staging table. The truncateStagingTab argument controls whether this method removes all data from the staging table after loading is complete.

        Parameters:
        flags - option to pass to the underlying operations. For example, to run the data loading in parallel degree 4, one can set the flags to "PARSE PARALLEL_CREATE_INDEX PARALLEL=4 mbv_method=shadow"
        tableName - name of the staging table holding the triples/quads to load into this dataset
        truncateStagingTab - if true, then truncate the staging tables after data loading is complete.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a problem inserting the data into the underlying Oracle semantic model
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        prepareBulk(java.io.InputStream, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.StatusListener, java.lang.String, boolean)

      • containsGraph

        public boolean containsGraph(org.apache.jena.graph.Node graphNode)
        Returns whether a graph with the specified graph name exists in this dataset. A graph exists in this dataset if and only if it contains data. In other words, this method will return false if the graph is empty.

        Note that even if this method returns false for a given graph name, the getGraph(Node) method will always return a graph for a given name.

        This method expects graphNode to be the name of a named graph only (not the default graph or null).

        Specified by:
        containsGraph in interface org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraph
        Overrides:
        containsGraph in class org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraphWrapper
        Parameters:
        graphNode - name of graph to check for existence in this dataset
        Returns:
        true if a graph with the given name exists in this dataset and is not empty.

      • copyFrom

        public static DatasetGraphOracleSem copyFrom(DatasetGraphOracleSem dgos,
                                             Oracle oracle)
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        This static method returns an instance of DatasetGraphOracleSem based on the metadata associated with the DatasetGraphOracleSem passed as the argument.

        New resources will be created and there will be no sharing with original input graph.

        This is a convenient method for http applications where a new instance is needed to process concurrent http requests. The web application can create a new instance of the dataset graph on demand, and using a new Oracle object returned from a connection pool.

        Parameters:
        dgos - DatasetGraphOracleSem object on which to base the new
        oracle - the Oracle object ot be associated with DatasetGraphOracleSem instance
        Returns:
        DatasetGraphOracleSem object based on the same underlying model as dgos and sharing the same resources as gos
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • createFrom

        public static DatasetGraphOracleSem createFrom(GraphOracleSem gos)
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        This static method returns an instance of DatasetGraphOracleSem based on the metadata associated with the GraphOracleSem passed as the argument.

        Both the DatasetGraphOracleSem object returned and the GraphOracleSem object, gos, passed as the argument will share the same JDBC connection, JDBC and SQL settings, and underlying Oracle RDF model, attachment, and model settings. This means that any commits performed in one object will also commit changes made in the other object.

        Although both objects share the same resources, closing one object will not close the other. To ensure proper closing of the shared JDBC connection and freeing of shared resources, close both the DatasetGraphOracleSem object and GraphOracleSem object after use.

        Note that the GraphOracleSem object pass as an argument, gos, does not need to remain open to use the DatasetGraphOracleSem object returned by this method. It is a good practice to close the gos object after the DatasetGraphOracleSem object is instantiated.

        The GraphOracleSem object, gos, must not be null.

        Parameters:
        gos - GraphOracleSem object on which to base the new DatasetGraphOracleSem instance
        Returns:
        DatasetGraphOracleSem object based on the same underlying model as gos and sharing the same resources as gos
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • find

        public java.util.Iterator<org.apache.jena.sparql.core.Quad> find(org.apache.jena.graph.Node g,

                                                                 org.apache.jena.graph.Node p,
                                                                 org.apache.jena.graph.Node o)

      • performInference

        public void performInference()
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a rules index/entailment based on the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model and any other attached models and rulebases via Attachment.

        Note that the transaction will be committed before any inference is carried out.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error during native inferencing.
        See Also:
        deleteInference(), setInferenceOption(java.lang.String)

      • performInference

        public void performInference(java.lang.String components)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a rules index/entailment based on the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model and any other attached models and rulebases via Attachment.

        Note that the transaction will be committed before any inference is carried out. Call rollbackTransaction() if there are any changes that should not be persisted.

        The components argument specifies the inference components to enable and use. It is only applicable to Oracle 11g and it can be null. When not null, it provides the ability for selective inferencing. See the following document for details: Oracle Database Semantic Technologies Developer's Guide 11g Release 2 (11.2).

        Parameters:
        components - specifies the INF_COMPONENTS_IN parameter in the SEM_APIS.CREATE_ENTAILMENT PL/SQL interface.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is server side error.
        See Also:
        deleteInference(), setInferenceOption(java.lang.String)

      • performInference

        public void performInference(java.lang.String components,
                             java.lang.String deltaModel)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a rules index/entailment based on the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model and any other attached models and rulebases via Attachment.

        Note that the transaction will be committed before any inference is carried out. Call rollbackTransaction() if there are any changes that should not be persisted.

        The components argument specifies the inference components to enable and use. It is only applicable to Oracle 11g and it can be null. When not null, it provides the ability for selective inferencing. See the following document for details: Oracle Database Semantic Technologies Developer's Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1).

        The deltaModel argument specifies the name of the model that tracks added triples to use for incremental inference. Please refer to the delta_in parameter of SEM_APIS.create_entailment API in the Oracle Database Semantic Technologies Developer's Guide. Specifying null for deltaModel will disable use of incremental inferencing. Note that incremental inferencing does not work for all types of inferencing (e.g. local inferencing).

        Parameters:
        components - specifies the INF_COMPONENTS_IN parameter in the SEM_APIS.CREATE_ENTAILMENT PL/SQL interface.
        deltaModel - the name of the model that stores additional triples for incremental inference, or null to disable local inferencing
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is server side error.
        See Also:
        deleteInference(), setInferenceOption(java.lang.String)

      • populateCache

        public void populateCache()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method populates mid-tier cache with all the data from the underlying model. This method uses the default number of threads to populate the cache.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        See Also:
        populateCache(int)

      • populateCache

        public void populateCache(int numThreads)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method populates mid-tier cache with all the data from the underlying model. The parameter numThreads controls the degree of parallelism to use when populating the cache.

        numThreads must be greater than 0.

        Parameters:
        numThreads - number of threads to use to populate the cache
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • prepareBulk

        public void prepareBulk(java.io.InputStream in,
                        java.lang.String baseURI,
                        java.lang.String lang,
                        java.lang.String tablespaceName,
                        java.lang.String flags,
                        StatusListener listener,
                        java.lang.String tableName,
                        boolean truncate)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.sql.SQLException
        Loads a collection of triples/quads into a given staging table. Note, this method executes a commit when finished.

        This method alone will not load the collection of triples/quads into this dataset. To finish loading triples/quads into this dataset, call completeBulk after calling this method.

        A staging table should not be confused with an application table. The staging table is temporary storage for the collection of triples/quads, to be used later by the completeBulk method.

        If no tablespace name is specified (e.g. tablespaceName is null), then this method will use the same tablespace used by the Oracle semantic network that holds the MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ table.

        If the staging table name, tableName, is null, then this method will automatically create a staging table. To complete bulk loading from the automatically created staging table, the staging table name passed to the completeBulk method must also be set to null.

        Note that whether a staging table name is specified or not, another staging table may be automatically created by this method to store triples/quads with long object values. If the supplied staging table name, tableName, is not null, then this second staging table will have the name, 

        <blockquote> tableName + "_"</blockquote>

        For example, if the staging table name is "STAGING_TABLE", the second staging table will have the name "STAGING_TABLE_".

        Parameters:
        in - input stream that provides a collection of triples/quads.
        baseURI - base URI used when parsing the data provided.
        lang - data format.
        tablespaceName - tablespace to use for holding intermediate data created by server logic (can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used)
        flags - option to pass to the underlying operations.
        listener - an object of StatusListener that keeps track of loading progress.
        tableName - name of the staging table that is going to temporarily hold the triples/quads, or null to have a table automatically created
        truncate - truncate the contents of staging tables if true.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem dealing with the input stream.
        java.sql.SQLException
        See Also:
        completeBulk(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • removeGraph

      • setDefaultGraph

        public void setDefaultGraph(org.apache.jena.graph.Graph g)
        Replaces data associated with the default graph with the data in the specified graph, g. This method will remove all existing data in the default graph before adding the data from the specified graph. To add data to the default graph without replacing existing data, use the add(Quad) function instead.

        Changes will be committed to the database after this API call.

        Specified by:
        setDefaultGraph in interface org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraph
        Overrides:
        setDefaultGraph in class org.apache.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraphWrapper
        Parameters:
        g - graph whose data will replace existing data in the default graph of this dataset
        See Also:
        add(org.apache.jena.sparql.core.Quad)

      • setDOP

        Parameters:
        i - degree of parallelism to use

      • setInferenceOption

        public void setInferenceOption(java.lang.String inferenceOption)
        Set the inference option used by performInference (create_entailment).

        One can enable parallel and/or incremental inference as well as set using RAW datatype through this API.

        Parameters:
        inferenceOption - the inference option to use when performing inference. For example, in a balanced database setup with multiple CPU cores, one can set the inferenceOption to "DOP=4,RAW8=T"
        See Also:
        performInference(java.lang.String)

      • setQueryFetchSize

        public void setQueryFetchSize(int size)

        Note that this setting is shared with any graphs retrieved using the getGraph(Node) and getDefaultGraph() methods.

        Parameters:

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable obj,
                   java.lang.Object message)
        Observers if any observable object has sent an state change message. This method applies just for datasets from Fuseki server. Each Fuseki request is processed with a copy of the original dataset defined in configuration file.         Specified by:
